title: Jilted John swamped with offers
text:
Married at First Sight’s jilted John swamped with single women wanting to fall in love February 15, 2017 9:09pm Image John from Married at First Sight mingles with older singles 0:35 
After leaving the show single, John from Married at First Sight finds himself at the centre of a group of eager single women. CREDIT: ACA/Channel 9 February 15th 2017 an hour ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ The women who fell for John after his treatment by Deb on Married at First Sight and want to spend the rest of their lives with him. Picture: A Current Affair Ian Horswill News Corp Australia Network Share Share on Twitter 
MARRIED at First Sight’s John was never what ‘Polynesian-mad’ Deb wanted. The pair left the Channel 9 dating show on Monday after the father-of-two chose to leave the “marriage” and broke up with Deb, who had asked for a Polynesian man , by letter. But since returning home to Sydney 53-year-old John has found himself a wanted man and he is still looking for a love match.. Channel 9 claimed it had been swamped with emails from single women begging for an introduction to John, who is quickly become the country’s most eligible bachelor. The introduction for around 10 women was set up and shown tonight on A Current Affair. There was Connie, “pushing 60”, who also has children. “I am a little bit older but think we would be a great match. I think John and I have a lot in common,” she gushed. John was invited back to her house by this woman on A Current Affair. Source: Channel 9 One of the single women who had fallen for John. Source: Channel 9 The single women seemed to have taken to John to their hearts after his treatment by Deb. Source: Channel 9 One of the women on A Current Affair who was single and saw John as a perfect partner. Source: Channel 9 Jules, 51, thought John was “a bit of all right” when he was on Married at First Sight. He’s really good-looking and he’s very down-to-earth. He’d make a great catch. Lousie, 58, said her daughter thought they would “make a great match” and had been spreading the news on Facebook. “I like to have a drink. I’m a smoker, so I have my Tic Tacs tonight. Come and approach me.” There was also 55-year-old Di, who declared: “We are all available”. “I have been separated for 18 months. It’s hard to find someone out there. When I saw John on TV, I just went, ‘Oh hello’. “He seems so genuine and came across so human. His love of his daughters just drew me ... I cried.” John was kept behind a curtain. His daughters Jessie and Emma were also there to check on any potential new mum. They also said they had been trying to organise their dad with a new date. Married at First Sight’s jilted John with his daughters, Emma and Jessie. Picture: Nicki Connolly   “I’m flattered. They might be very disappointed once they meet me,” John said. “Actually I’m really rapt. It has been fantastic.” The curtain was drawn open and John, whom Jess called “a very social person”, came out to meet his suitors. Lots of selfies were taken and John tried to meet as many women as he could. Some of the women were very forward, with one giving him a kiss on the cheek and another inviting him back to her place and her spa, which she said was lonely when on her own. One of the women gave him a kiss on the cheek, the only one of the night. Picture: A Current Affair Source: Channel 9 John discovered that some of the female suitors were very forward and knew a lot about him. Picture: Channel 9 Source: Channel 9 John is spoilt for choice as he is swamped by the lonely hearts. Picture: A Current Affair Source: Channel 9 This single woman found John ‘a lot shorter’ in real; ife than on Married at First Sight. Picture: A Current Affair Source: Channel 9 Some women held back with one telling John he “looked a lot shorter than on the TV”. John found the event a little overwhelming with so much attention but his daughters were keeping an eye on the women. Love waits for no man, does it John? Married at First Sight - Deb walks out 0:34 
On Married at First Sight - Deb has had enough at the dinner and walks out. CREDIT: Channel 9 February 8th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ Married at First Sight - Deb gets upset 0:32 
On Married at First Sight - Deb gets upset and wishes she had got what she wanted as a partner. CREDIT: Channel 9 February 7th 2017
